revised_title: Sidney Henry Haughton: A Distinguished Geologist and Gondwana Researcher
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Sidney Henry Haughton, a prominent geologist and paleontologist who contributed significantly to the understanding of the Gondwana supercontinent. Haughton collected fossils from the Karroo System and Quaternary periods in South Africa, working alongside notable geologists A. W. Rogers and A. L. du Toit. His work helped to trace the evolution of creatures that inhabited the Gondwana supercontinent.
